Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 4. Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by 0.0019 units, creating a rectangular prism with the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.0019 * Height: 0.75 Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a rectangular cutout Sketching the cutout shape 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0806, 0.0019, 0.0528] 2. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6444. 4. Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by 0.0156 units, followed by extrusion along the opposite direction of normals also by 0.0156 units. This will create a cylindrical object with a central rectangular hole with the following dimensions: * Length: 0.6444 * Width: 0.0313 * Height: 0.6444 Final shape The CAD assembly consists of a rectangular prism and a cylindrical object with a rectangular cutout. The height and width of the assembled solid are determined by the dimensions of the rectangular prism, while its length is influenced by the combined lengths of the prism and the cylindrical object. Any interference or connections between the parts must be addressed according to their geometrical interactions.</description>
